content.description: A long white wall opposite the Jackknife Crack. There are many problem possible along this wall, as well as a long traverse (probably no harder than 5.8) A variety of features makes this less than vertical wall very fun. Starts about 10' but moves to 20' at the the left end. Has potential for harder problems.
Look for the roof with pockets and climb.
content.protection: Misc difficult gear or top rope.

content.description: A large face with multiple routes. Easiest way to set up a top rope for the other side.

Good looking crack on the opposite side from the Low Angle Wall. It starts off-width at the bottom, but narrows at the top. Sharp due to the ironite edges. Careful...if you pop off on the bottom 1/2 you will hit the white wall behind you. Bottom 1/2 is usually glazed with shoe rubber.
content.protection: Top Rope from trees on top. Good lead if you have the pro. Medium to Large Pro.

content.description: This route climbs the orange face on the southeast corner of the Low Angle Wall Boulder. Climb a short, easy slab section to an obvious crack below the roof. Follow the crack out and around the roof until it thins out. From the top of the crack follow pockets and face holds up and right to the top. The line goes with gear but does require some creativity and questionable placements.
content.location: This route starts below the roof on orange face that makes up the southeast corner of the Low Angle Boulder.

content.description: Marked by huge buckets, in the same "walk way" as Jacknife Crack and White Face. Numerous lines available. Would be difficult to find one over 5.9.
Climb the lower angle slabs in the wide crack to the 2" crack at the top.
Traverse the Bucket Face/ Jackknife Crack wall along the obvious crack from left to right.
content.protection: Cams and a good belayer...top rope

content.description: This is a large formation to the Right of Mushroom Boulder (the prominent boulder upon entering the area). Follow the trail to the right of some smaller boulders and you will clearly see a house sized boulder with a slabby, knobby face. The back side has many pockets, buckets and wasps!
